title: enh: Rename `date` type to `datetime` to better reflect its utility.
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
This relates to clarifying the scope of the dtype `date`

**Describe the use case**
The data type `date` typically use used for date only that do not contain any time component.  Given `date` type in ludwig does allow an optional time component, suggest renaming this to "datetime" that matches the specification [ISO 8061](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html).

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Refactor all references to [DATE](https://github.com/ludwig-ai/ludwig/blob/master/ludwig/constants.py#L29) constant to refer to a new `DATETIME` value.

Also add backwards compatbility for mapping to old configurations, perhaps this could be done when [inferring types](https://github.com/ludwig-ai/ludwig/blob/master/ludwig/automl/base_config.py#L331).
